tags: you are not immune to propaganda
summary: Y'all seriously need to stop acting like Disney/Marvel and Warner Media/DC are these uber progressive companies just because...
body:
Y'all seriously need to stop acting like Disney/Marvel and Warner Media/DC are these uber progressive companies just because they throw us a few bones every now and again like Captain Marvel (which I still haven’t seen) or the Batwoman TV show. These soulless mega corporations aren’t “woke” at all: they’re chasing a trend.

They know it’s highly profitable to appeal to the “woke” demographic that are demanding representation in everything at the moment, but trust me, the second all of that stops making them money, they’ll drop all of it like a bad habit.

Bi-ace and very queer. Any/all pronouns. I live with chronic and mental illnesses. Multi-fandom, because thematical consistency is overrated, but mostly visual novels, tabletop gaming and badass ladies. My DMs are always open. You can buy me a coffee to support me: 
Ko-fi.com/sapphovonchat

tags: i thought the version of this in the movie brought the point across
but the idea that a male hero who behaved like this
wouldn't be called awesome and a badass
summary: Apparently the latest misogynistic talking point against Captain Marvel is that the behavior in the cut ‘give me your jacket’...
body: Apparently the latest misogynistic talking point against Captain Marvel is that the behavior in the cut ‘give me your jacket’ scene makes Carol a terrible, unheroic person.  Which is hilarious when you consider that this scene is basically a word-for-word lift of the “I need your clothes, your jacket, and your bike” scene from the Terminator films.  And I have never once seen anyone call Arnie a terrible, unheroic person for that sort of behavior - which very much includes discussions of Terminator 1, when he was playing the villain.

title: Harley’s Marble-ous Meal
body:
Title: Harley’s Marble-ous Meal
Pairing: Billy Batson & Harley Quinn
Rating: Gen
Word Count: 3,697
Summary: Harley Quinn had a Foolproof Plan ™ for her trip to Fawcett City, a plan that involved a very special Billy Batson.

Fawcett City. America’s Lightning Rod. The city had recorded the highest number of lightning strikes per year in the country every year since the debut of their very own super-duper flying-brickhouse superhero. Which should not come as a surprise, considering that their superhero wore a lightning symbol on his chest and called himself Captain… Marbles? Marlboro? Marlboro Lights? Ain’t that a cigarette brand? What did that have to do with lightning?

Anywho.

The point was, Harley was having herself a vacation.


[Keep reading on AO3]

tags: sexism does play a role in these hate videos
whether you like captain marvel or not you have to admit that this ideology isn't okay to expose kids to
summary:
The problem with Brie Larson hate videos on Youtube
No matter what you do. If you're a Marvel fan you'll get recommended these...
body:
The problem with Brie Larson hate videos on Youtube

No matter what you do. If you’re a Marvel fan you’ll get recommended these hate videos. Know what my problem with these videos is? Well besides the hate. It’s the fact that there are fans that are kids who will get recommended these videos too. Kids younger than 10 are getting phones and now have access to more than just basic knowledge but exposure to right wing content and hateful videos.

Why do I bring this up? Because I have a 12 yr old nephew who watched these videos and fed into the content of hating Captain Marvel and hating feminism. And I found him joking to his baby sister saying, “You belong in the kitchen, that’s what your gender is for.” Because the comments and the anti-feminism message of these videos were absorbed by him. I had to have a serious talk with him about how it wasn’t okay.

It bothers me that there are probably young girls watching these videos and feeling bad about themselves. There are literal sexist comments about women in these hate videos and it sucks thinking that as an adult i just wanna enjoy Captain Marvel videos, imagine what a young kid or teen must be feeling being exposed to this. Being exposed even more early to sexism and as a young person, could possibly effect their views and morals.

Thus only furthering gender inequality ideology.

Not just that. But for male kids and teens. They might have originally liked Captain Marvel but then watch these videos and are turned against liking Captain Marvel and get sexist feelings after watching it. Like my nephew.

I feel bad for the young kids and teens who like Captain Marvel and will have to stumble across this right-wing hateful content. I firmly believe Youtube needs to get rid of videos like this because I hate seeing my nephew act sexist at a young age. Kids absorb content, they pay attention.

I’m not trying to sound like a “Oh but the children!” Kind of person. But literally this type of content can effect how people think. Especially in kids. I had an adult male friend of mine who enjoyed Captain Marvel then got turned against her in seconds after watching those videos. I worry for what anyone younger would think. You don’t even have to be a fan or like Captain Marvel, just be worried that some kids are being taught sexism quite easily through YouTube. As adults we need to make sure we teach kids to respect each other and not discriminate against gender.

I hope that this hate eventually dies off because kids shouldn’t be taught to be sexist.

blog.name: oh-the-mess-i-make
blog.title: The Blackhole

summary: Yeah let's take all opportunity we can to paint Captain Marvel a "true villain" based on things that no one bats an eye at with...
body:
Yeah let’s take all opportunity we can to paint Captain Marvel a “true villain” based on things that no one bats an eye at with Male heroes.

Are we not gonna bring up how repeated Logan, the precious Wolverine we all love, have done precisely the same thing over and over again? It’s not criminal if a character like Wolverine or countless other heroes do the same? Dont get me wrong, wolverine is one of my favorites but seeing articles like this poke holes in Captain Marvel to make some sort of statement on feminism vs masculinity on this basis is cheap.

Anyways, diving really deep to try and make Captain Marvel problematic is really boring and while I agree that in anything but a superhero movie this would be questionable, I really think this alone doesnt constitute as shocking or remotely “villainous” compared to what else happens in superhero movies. Here’s the link to the article

summary: Bucky: taken away from the life he knew, brain washed, forgot everyone important to him, used as an emotionless soldier for the...
body:
Bucky: taken away from the life he knew, brain washed, forgot everyone important to him, used as an emotionless soldier for the villains, killed people

Everyone: poor baby. We must protect him. He did no wrong. It wasn’t his fault.

Carol: taken away from the life she knew, brain washed, forgot those important to her, used as an emotionless soldier for the villains, broke a guy’s arm because he was harassing her in a scene that was clearly a Terminator 2 reference

Everyone: villain!! Put her in jail!!! Terrible person!!! Sexist against men!!

(Btw, I love Bucky. There’s no hate from me. But I love Carol just as damn much and she does not deserve the hate she gets)

I am also a...

tags: It's amazing how people do not understand
like having a character be needlessly violent to start with
- because that's what she's been brainwashed to act like -
before realising the people who taught her this were manipulative and wrong.
summary: The scene with Carol injuring the guys hand is very much like the scene where Thor smashes the mug in the diner, demanding for...
body:
The scene with Carol injuring the guys hand is very much like the scene where Thor smashes the mug in the diner, demanding for another. Because neither of them quite understands that this behaviour is wrong and unacceptable on Earth or how they should have handle the individual situations. Thor because he’s not from the planet, and Carol because she can’t remember anything and has been brainwashed and manipulated by the Kree in thinking otherwise.

The big difference is that Thor learns what he did in the diner was wrong. He then goes back and replaces the mug to prove he knows better with a sincere apology.
Meanwhile Carol remembers everything of her life on Earth - including what the men were like - and realises that nearly getting his hand broken was probably a good lesson for the ass hole so she’ll just leave him with that little reminder.

:)
